Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body, a flat-topped tapering nozzle with a rounded tip, a lug on the right side with a single impression, and a base-ring. The filling-hole is surrounded by a raised ridge, an inward-sloping rim, and a grooved outer edge. Around the rim is a band of short rays; a similar band of rays, depending from a circular groove, decorates the shoulder. The nozzle top is defined by a groove, and is divided from the filling-hole rim by a double volute. In the centre of the base-ring is a small impressed circle. Covered with a bright red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q750)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir John Tomlinson Brunner
Donated by: Sir Henry Hoyle Howorth
